Torture did not lead to bin Laden. Key intel was in hand before EITs began. This timeline lays out the evidence.http://1.usa.gov/1xbWplc
CIA Director John Brennan: “In some instances, we simply failed to live up to the standards that we set for ourselves.” #ReadTheReport
The CIA helps keep our nation safe and strong. Torture does not. We must learn from our mistakes and never repeat them. #ReadTheReport
Torture doesn't work. Traditional intelligence collection, interrogation and law enforcement do. #ReadTheReport
It should be to stand firm in our values and work with our allies to root out extremism and terrorism in all its forms.
The response to their threats and terrorism should not be for us to change our American values.
Study is not only Democrats. 14-1 vote in 09 to begin; 9-6 in 12 to approve (w/ GOP Senator Snowe); 11-3 in 2014 to release. #ReadTheReport
100+ interview transcripts, oral and written testimony, CIA response and numerous CIA meetings contributed to study. #ReadTheReport
Director Brennan: “I certainly agree that there were times when CIA officers exceeded the policy guidance that was given.” #ReadTheReport
Answers to questions about the study of the CIA detention & interrogation program are available here. #ReadTheReport http://1.usa.gov/1ugDazH
Exec summary backed up by 6,700-pg classified report, 38,000 footnotes. Every fact is based on CIA records, cables, etc #ReadTheReport
Brennan: In some cases, unauthorized interrogation techniques “were abhorrent and rightly should be repudiated by all.” #ReadTheReport
